result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley Lynn Taggart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 2 years, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain an Associate Degree in Business Managment or a related field during the pendency of probation term.
No contact with R. Rice and/or M. Hooper directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:06 p.m. Defendant Ashley Lynn Taggart in court with attorney William M. Lennon. Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Lennon. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 yrs probation - Conditions: 15 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, 3 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 12-15-2014, AODA and follow through, NC w/ M. Hooper and/or R. Rice, DE to obtain an associates degree, Costs to include $240 purchase money w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample and surcharge. DE may petition the court for early termination after a period of 2 years. Upon successful completion of probation the defendant may petition for expungment. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Ashley Lynn Taggart in court with attorney William M. Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lennon requesting a P/S date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on September 10, 2014 at 01:55 pm.

Case called @ 2:09 p.m. Defendant Ashley Lynn Taggart in court with attorney William M. Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 01:55 pm.
State's
William Lennon
Initial appearance on July 31, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:06 p.m. Defendant Ashley Lynn Taggart in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Referred to SPD - DE is working part time. ADA Anderson requesting $1500 Sig Bond. No statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $1500 Sig Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
